description.plain:
Daniel Nwosu Jr. (born March 22, 1994), better known by his stage name Dax, is a Canadian Hip Hop artist with a huge YouTube presence of more than 4.5 million subscribers who went viral with the official music video of his song “Cash Me Outside.” He is also known for his remixes of popular rap songs, such as “WHAT’S POPPIN” and “Godzilla.”

Before he got famous he was a big time basketball player, he was named MVP at Sunrise Christian Academy in his senior season. He then played for Casper College before heading to the University of Montana, and finally transferring to Newman University, where he head the Heartland Conference in scoring. While at Newman University, he worked part-time as a janitor. Additionally, he has enjoyed doing spoken-word poetry and has been a traveling motivational speaker.

Dax released his first EP, It’s Different Now, in August of 2018, featuring Futuristic and O.T.Genasis. Dax released his second EP, I’ll Say It For You, in March of 2020. The EP is supported by the singles “Dear God” and “Book of Revelations.”

After releasing a wide variety of singles from 2020 to 2021, Dax released his debut studio album, Pain Paints Paintings, October of 2021.

On November 23, 2021, Dax released the single “The Next Rap God 2.” In the song’s official music video, Dax teased his fans that if the song did not reach up to 500,000 likes before 2022, he would sign to a major label. He kept his promise in September 2022, when it was revealed that Dax had signed a record deal with Columbia Records, although Dax continues to release music independently.

On August 18, 2023, after releasing music both through Columbia and independently through YouTube, Dax released his first major label EP and his third EP overall, What is life?.

songs.title: Dear God

description.plain:
Dax has a compilcated relationship with God. which he describes more on this song’s lyrics, Dax also says he’s a believer but in the song he’s still asking why he hasn’t seen results from god when he was in his darkest places.
This song is some sort of a conversation where Dax reaches out to God, and asks him why all those things happen.

songs.title: My Last Words

description.plain:
After extensive promotion for this track, Dax released “My Last Words” as a single from his Fuck Love EP on April 5, 2019.

On the song itself, Dax stated via his Twitter feed:

[The song] is purpose driven. I was told you’ll find the most talent in the graveyard. Too many of us leave gifts inside and don’t expose them to the world. That’s what this song is all about. I’m saying goodbye to the old me and so will you.

Dax additionally wrote this song to question those who listened to the song, and those his piece of work reached, with the question: “Are you living to die, or dying to live?”

Much of the song’s material looks at Dax’s past, his prior relationships, and regrets, with a small shoutout to his songs “She Cheated” and “She Cheated Again”, which were milestones for his career. It is essentially a rundown of Dax’s entire personal life and feelings in two minutes and conceptually serves as his “last words” in a fictional scenario where he is about to die.

songs.title: Killshot Freestyle

description.plain:
Dax made another remix of an EMINEM song. First, it was Rap God Freestyle, now he’s back with Killshot Freestyle. He still seeks Eminem’s attention, leaving his phone number in hope of Em calling him

The other reason for Dax making “Killshot” is the various threats from British Youtube sensation KSI. On Miniminters. “What’s Good podcast”, JJ had this to say about Dax

Dax is a poor man’s Hopsin, and Hopsin is a poor man’s Eminem, and Eminem is a poor man’s Kendrick, so why would anyone want to listen to a poor man’s, poor man’s poor man.

This comment in particular infuriated Dax and 5 days after the initial podcast was released, Dax dropped “Killshot”

songs.full_title: The Next Rap God 2 by Dax
songs.title: The Next Rap God 2

description.plain:
“The Next Rap God 2” is a sequel to Dax’s June 2021 single of the same name. The song was released on November 23, 2021. It marks Dax’s first release following the release of his debut studio album, Pain Paints Paintings, which released a month prior to this song’s release.

On the track, Dax raps for twenty minutes on a wide variety of beats, all of which were produced by Pendo46 and LexNour Beats, proving himself that he is the next “Rap God”, by rapping fast and using clever lyricism. It is currently Dax’s longest song to date, however it is expected to get surpassed with a one hour long version, as teased on the track at the very end.

On November 22, Dax announced on his YouTube channel that if he wants the fans to hear new Dax’s music.

Y’all want BARS!? Or nah!? ONLY LIKE if you do. Choose WISELY because this is a WORLD RECORD BREAKING AMOUNT thAt will requIRE MONTHS TO BREAK DOWN…

In the same post, Dax announced that the song will prove from the fans if he will continue to stay as an independent artist or will get signed to a major record label.

If this gets dropped you will ALL SOON be deciding whether I stay INDEPENDENT or SIGN to a MAJOR LABEL… it is what it is. I love u… my actions prove that 🙏🏾

Following the release of the song and it’s music video, on November 23, 2021, Dax announced both in the description of the song and in the very beginning of the video that if the song’s music video can’t reach up to 500,000 likes by the beginning of 2022, he will sign to a major record label.

if this doesn’t get 500k likes by Jan 1st i’m signing to a major label…

The music video did not reach the 500K goal, as it sits with a total of 287,000 likes, as of January 1, 2022. After months of silence, in September 2022, it was revealed that Dax had signed a record deal with Columbia Records.

songs.title: WHATS POPPIN Remix

description.plain: Dax remixes the hit song “WHATS POPPIN” by Jack Harlow. Dax gives us great wordplay and punchlines in a mainstream beat to prove that he’s one of the best.

songs.title: My Heart Hurts

description.plain: The last song on Dax’s third official album, I’ll Say It for You, “My Heart Hurts”, depicts the fall of a relationship Dax had with his ex-girlfriend. The song correlates with the previous song on the album “Love Hurts” and outlines how the girl tricked Dax multiple times. The girl depicted in “Love Hurts” and “My Heart Hurts” could be the same girl Dax referenced in his 2018 song “She Cheated Again”.

songs.full_title: I’m Not Joyner or Don Q by Dax
songs.title: I’m Not Joyner or Don Q
songs.title_with_featured: I’m Not Joyner or Don Q

description.plain:
Canadian rapper Dax becomes the latest rapper to diss Tory Lanez after Tory claimed to be “the best rapper alive.”

https://twitter.com/torylanez/status/1088315363635400709?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw








After teasing the song on his Instagram, Dax shared screenshots of his DM’s with Tory where Tory appears to threaten him and ask him not to drop the diss track. This is contrary to Tory’s recent trend of eagerly responding to other rappers' challenges. Dax released the track anyways, promoting it as a friendly competition.

However, on February 10, Tory confronted Dax and demanded an apology for releasing the track. The confrontation was recorded on Tory’s Instagram account in this video.

songs.full_title: THE NEXT RAP GOD by Dax
songs.title: THE NEXT RAP GOD

description.plain:
Dax is an underrated rapper; his lyricism and poetic skills are almost unmatched in the modern rap industry. Dax’s target demographic is people who listen closely to lyrics rather than “vibe” (though the latter is very possible because he can execute a wide variety of flows). Thus, his songs, including “THE NEXT RAP GOD”, are dense with double entendres, plays-on-words, puns, homophones, sudden changes in meter, and other lyircal/poetic skills which Dax claims elevate him to the status of rap God.

This style of rapping and rhyming SAT vocab words is also common in Eminem’s music, who first coined the term “Rap God” in his hit song. Dax even references the latter rapper as his “best friend” even though they have never met. Regardless if one appreciates his music or not, most agree that Dax’s lyricism is of a very high caliber.

songs.title: Love Hurts

description.plain: Love Hurts is a song with similar concepts to Dax’s 2018 release “She Cheated Again”. The instrumental used at the start of the song is similar to She Cheated Again as well and continues the story of how Dax built his relationship with this girl for two years. The girl described in the song is evidently his first relationship.

songs.title: Gotham

description.plain:
In this song Dax is speaking on how society is being washed by social media and the so called definition of happiness. Dax is trying to bring light to the problem of the amount of people primarily kids and children chasing fame on social media and leaving everything for gotham no matter what.

 I’m not going to change much in this edit but I think this is mainly directed towards the people who spend their lives as influencers and show off a fabulous perfect life but as soon as the cameras gone there are things like financial struggles and drug addiction and they make it look like their life is so perfect all for a few followers.
